item.title: Report X-2025011166
item.description:
Report X-2025011166

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON THE OUTBOUND AT BAY 459, SUPERVISOR DISCOVERED LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE ON THE GRATING AND NOTIFIED RMP ABOUT NEEDING A RESPONDER TO CLEAN UP THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE. RMP SENDED THE RESPONDER TO BAY 459 AND THE RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER LOOKED AT THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND THEN READ AND FOLLOWED THE CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH ZEP ZORBENT SINCE THATS WHAT THE CURRENT RESPONSE SHEET HAD ON AND CLEANED UP ZEP ZORBENT REMAINS AROUND THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE. RESPONDER TOOK BACK THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE TO THE PSC CAGE AND BEGAN PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025010331
item.description:
Report E-2025010331

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to it falling off a skid that resulted in the pails being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbent pads and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. They also used one (1) 10-gallon metal drum for the left-over product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010298
item.description:
Report E-2025010298

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A third party driver was delivering drums to Veolia's 10-day intransit facility in Sauget, IL. As the driver was backing up, the trailer backed into a pallet of drums that were staged to be loaded onto a 10-day trailer. One of the drums was damaged by the underride bar on the back of the trailer, resulting in the drum to starting to leak. Approximately 10 gallons of waste flammable liquids was spilled onto an impervious surface. The spill was contained and cleaned up appropriately, and the damaged drum was overpacked for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2025010257
item.description:
Report E-2025010257

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 17, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1133 was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized cleaners, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pail and all impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025010343
item.description:
Report E-2025010343

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 12:39 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XDP) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 1 teaspoon of V705-D Printing Ink (hazardous - UN1210) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the box container and did not impact the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged poly container will be placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2025010340
item.description:
Report E-2025010340

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 12:39 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XDP) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 1 teaspoon of V7211-D Printing Ink (hazardous - UN1210) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the box container and did not impact the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged poly container will be placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0134 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSW. It was reported that approximately 1-cup of Marvel Mystery Oil released from a plastic bottle due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #3194783. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and suggested a contractor for cleanup due to splash goggles being required; XPO declined and felt comfortable cleaning up the spill themselves.
